awd_titl_txt: Field Observations of Stratospheric Trace Gases in Support  of the UARS Mission
awd_abstract_narration: This grant supplies logistical and field support to make millimeter             wavelength radio measurements of the stratospheric gases, ozone,                nitrous oxide and, especially, chlorine monoxide.  The measurements             will be made from McMurdo, Antarctica.  The purpose is to provide               "ground truth" for the similar microwave emission spectrometer on               NASA's Upper Atmospheric Research Satellite (UARS).  The PI has                 been making similar measurements from Antarctica to study the                   annual ozone hole phenomena for several of the past few years.                                                                                                  The necessary support funds for the PI are being supplied by NASA.

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION FOR THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK
